tool_description: Mailgun is a programmable email platform. It allows your application to become a fully featured email server. Send, receive and track messages with ease using your favorite programming language.
name: Mailgun
title: Mailgun

api_list.name: Domain Credentials

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: The site whose credentials you want to retrieve

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mailgun.p.rapidapi.com/domains/site.com/credentials"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mailgun.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://mailgun.p.rapidapi.com/domains/{domain}/credentials"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mailgun.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Information for all domains
api_list.description: Retrieve information regarding associated domains with your account

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return. (100 by default)

optional_parameters.name: skip
optional_parameters.description: Number of records to skip. (0 by default)

api_list.name: Information about "yourdomain.com"
api_list.description: Retrieve only information linked to yourdomain.com
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mailgun.p.rapidapi.com/domains/sample.com"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mailgun.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://mailgun.p.rapidapi.com/domains/{domain}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mailgun.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
